description: The Meetup API provides simple RESTful HTTP and streaming interfaces for extending your community using the Meetup platform from your own apps.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: OAuth2

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: App key from meetup developer console

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: App secret from meetup developer console

args.name: code
args.info: Required: Ouath code

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: Required: App redirect URI

blocks.name: getCategories
blocks.description: Returns a list of Meetup group categories

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Parameter for requesting optional response properties
args.name: fields

blocks.name: getDashboard
blocks.description: A dashboard of aggregated Meetup information for the authorized member

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output
args.name: fields

blocks.name: getTopicCategories
blocks.description: Returns a list of Meetup topic categories

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Parameter for requesting optional response properties
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: Use a given latitude/longitude/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon. When present, all three are required.
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Use a given latitude/longitude/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon. When present, all three are required.
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Use a given latitude/longitude/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon. When present, all three are required.
args.name: latitude

blocks.name: getTopics
blocks.description: API method for accessing meetup topics

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Return topics a target member is subscribed to
args.name: memberId

args.info: Required: Return topics that match the specified name (e.g. 'Digital Photography', 'Classical Music')
args.name: name

args.info: Required: Return topics for this topic urlkey
args.name: topic

args.info: Required: Return topics related to a list of search terms [separate search keywords with +'s]
args.name: search

blocks.name: getOpenEvents
blocks.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Changes the interpretation of the "text" field from OR'd terms to AND'd terms
args.name: andText

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid latitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles
args.name: latitude

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid country code
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return events in the specified topic or topics specified by commas. This is the topic "urlkey" returned by the Topics method. If all supplied topics are unknown, a 400 error response is returned with the code "badtopic".
args.name: topic

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid city
args.name: city

args.info: Required: Include limited event information for private groups that wish to expose only a small amount of information about their events. This includes just: id, name, utc_offset, time, duration, yes_rsvp_count, waitlist_count, group, visibility, timezone. Value must be true or false.
args.name: limitedEvents

args.info: Required: Format of the description text, "html" or "plain". Defaults to "html"
args.name: textFormat

args.info: Required: Recomended: If searching in a country with states, a valid 2 character state code
args.name: state

args.info: Required: Recomended: Events that contain the given term or terms somewhere in their content. The terms are OR'd by default. Separate terms with " AND " for events that have combined terms. To have terms automatically AND'd, set the "and_text" to true
args.name: text

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return events in the specified category or categories specified by commas. This is the category id returned by the Categories method.
args.name: category

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid longitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Return events scheduled within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above). Note: to retrieve past events you must also update status value
args.name: time

args.info: Required: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25.0 -- maximum 100. May also be specified as "smart", a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: Status may be "upcoming", "past" or both separated by a comma. The default is "upcoming" only
args.name: status

blocks.name: getConcierge
blocks.description: Recommends upcoming meetups for the authorized member in a given location and in thier groups

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: A vgetConciergealid country code
args.name: country

args.info: Required: A valid city
args.name: city

args.info: Required: A valid longitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Format of the description text "html", "plain", or "simplehtml". Defaults to "html"
args.name: textFormat

args.info: Required: Comma delimited list of category ids to limit recommendations to
args.name: categoryId

args.info: Required: An opaque string used to page through results. This can be found appended to the 'next' link in the meta section of the response.
args.name: pageToken

args.info: Required: If searching in a country with states, a valid 2 character state code
args.name: state

args.info: Required: Return events scheduled within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above). Note: to retrieve past events you must also update status value
args.name: time

args.info: Required: Comma delimited list of topics to help inform recommendation
args.name: topicId

args.info: Required: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, defaults to the member's preferred radius or 0.5 -- maximum 100. May also be specified as "smart", a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: Boolean parameter. When set to true, events hosted by groups you have friends in will be recommended
args.name: withFriends

args.info: Required: set to "include" or "exclude" groups the authorized member belongs to. The default is "include". This includes groups in locations that may differ than the provided location
args.name: selfGroups

args.info: Required: A valid latitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles
args.name: latitude

blocks.name: getGroups
blocks.description: Fetch information about Meetup Groups.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Return the group with this topic and number
args.name: groupNum

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return the group with this topic and number
args.name: topic

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles.
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: A valid latitude and longitude, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid latitude and longitude, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles
args.name: latitude

args.info: Required: Recomended: one or more separated by commas, includes no slashes
args.name: groupUrlName

args.info: Required: Recomended: Only return groups in the specified topic [one topic allowed]
args.name: topic

args.info: Required: Recomended: one or more separated by commas
args.name: groupId

args.info: Required: Recomended: one or more organizer IDs, separated by commas
args.name: organizerId

args.info: Required: Recomended: one or more custom group domains, separated by commas
args.name: domain

args.info: Required: Recomended: one or more separated by commas, for groups this member belongs to
args.name: memberId

args.info: Required: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25 -- maximum 100
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: optional result fields, separated by commas.
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: Recomended: Only return groups in the specified category. [one category allowed]
args.name: categoryId

args.info: Required: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles
args.name: state

args.info: Required: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles
args.name: city

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles
args.name: country

blocks.name: getEvents
blocks.description: Access Meetup events using a group, member, or event id. Events in private groups are available only to authenticated members of those groups. To search events by topic or location, see [Open Events](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/2/open_events).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Recomended: Filters events by the currently authenticated member's RSVP status. May be a comma delimited list of "yes", "no", "waitlist", "maybe" or "none"
args.name: rsvp

args.info: Required: Recomended: Path to group from meetup.com, no slashes
args.name: groupUrlName

args.info: Required: Recomended: Multiple ids may be separated with commas
args.name: eventId

args.info: Required: Recomended: Multiple ids may be separated with commas
args.name: groupId

args.info: Required: Include limited event information for private groups that wish to expose only a small amount of information about their events. This includes just: id, name, utc_offset, time, duration, yes_rsvp_count, waitlist_count, group, visibility, timezone. Value must be true or false.
args.name: limitedEvents

args.info: Required: Format of the description text, "html" or "plain". Defaults to "html"
args.name: textFormat

args.info: Required: Recomended: Group custom domain
args.name: groupDomain

args.info: Required: Recomended: Multiple ids may be separated with commas
args.name: venueId

args.info: Required: Recomended: Single member id, to find events in this member's groups
args.name: memberId

args.info: Required: Return events scheduled within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above). Note: to retrieve past events you must also update status value
args.name: time

args.info: Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: Status may be "upcoming", "past", "proposed", "suggested", "cancelled", "draft" or multiple separated by a comma. The default is "upcoming", which includes Meetups that are happening now according to their **duration**. Meetups that are "proposed" or "suggested" do not have a date assigned; the former are listed on the site as official while the latter appear as in the making. Drafts are only visible to organizers of groups hosting the events.
args.name: status
accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Total number of RSVPs available for the event
args.name: rsvpLimit

args.info: Required: Users with permission may set the RSVP open time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
args.name: rsvpOpen

args.info: Required: Controls the visibility of the event venue for non members of the hosting group. May be one of "public" or "members"
args.name: venueVisibility

args.info: Required: Up to 5 comma-separated valid member ids to be hosts for the event. If hosts is not provided, the authorized member is the default host
args.name: hosts

args.info: Required: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions for the event with each being up to 250 characters. See the parameter notes section for more information. See postEvent README for more details.
args.name: addNewQuestions

args.info: Required: Recomended: URL name of the Group hosting the event
args.name: groupUrlName

args.info: Required: We should do this because... May not be longer than 250 characters.
args.name: why

args.info: Required: Longer description of the event, in HTML. May not be longer than 50000 characters.
args.name: description

args.info: Required: The information provided by the event host for "How will members find you there?". Visible when location is visible to the authenticated member
args.name: howToFindUs

args.info: Required: Recomended: Group hosting the event
args.name: groupId

args.info: Required: Users with permission may set the RSVP close time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
args.name: rsvpClose

args.info: Required: Event duration in milliseconds. When not specified, a default of 3 hours may be assumed by applications. To clear event duration, set this to 0
args.name: duration

args.info: Required: Recomended: Name of the event. May not be longer than 80 characters.
args.name: name

args.info: Required: Number of guests members may include in their RSVP, 0 or more
args.name: guestLimit

args.info: Required: Description of the event, in simple HTML format. This value is translated to HTML to update the description. May not be longer than 50000 characters.
args.name: simpleHtmlDescription

args.info: Required: Event start time in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
args.name: time

args.info: Required: Numeric identifier of a venue
args.name: venueId

args.info: Required: If you are an organizer of the group, you may set this to "draft" to save the event as a draft. Doing so will require a status=draft filter on /2/event queries.
args.name: publishStatus

blocks.name: editEvent
blocks.description: Update an existing Meetup

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: id
args.info: Required: Event id.
Required: Updates to the venue's latitude and longitude. When present, both must be provided
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Updates to the venue's latitude and longitude. When present, both must be provided
args.name: latitude

args.info: Required: Total number of RSVPs available for the event. To remove this limit, set this to 0
args.name: rsvpLimit

args.info: Required: Users with permission may set the RSVP open time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
args.name: rsvpOpen

args.info: Required: Controls the visibility of venue. May be one of "public" or "members"
args.name: venueVisibility

args.info: Required: Up to 5 valid member ids to be hosts for the event.
args.name: hosts

args.info: Required: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions with each being up to 250 characters, including edited questions, for the event. See the parameter notes section for more information. See editEvent README for more details.
args.name: addNewQuestions

args.info: Required: We should do this because... May not be longer than 250 characters.
args.name: why

args.info: Required: Longer description of the event, in HTML. May not be longer than 50000 characters.
args.name: description

args.info: Required: The information provided by the event host for "How will members find you there?". Visible when location is visible to the authenticated member
args.name: howToFindUs

args.info: Required: Users with permission may set the RSVP close time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format. To unset rsvp_close, set this to 0
args.name: rsvpClose

args.info: Required: Organizers and hosts may set this to true to announce a Meetup.
args.name: announce

args.info: Required: Event duration in milliseconds. When not specified, a default of 3 hours may be assumed by applications. To clear event duration, set this to 0
args.name: duration

args.info: Required: Group to hold the event
args.name: groupId

args.info: Required: Event name. May not be longer than 80 characters.
args.name: name

args.info: Required: number of guests members may include in their RSVP, 0 or more
args.name: guestLimit

args.info: Required: Description of the event, in simple HTML format. This value is translated to HTML to update the description. May not be longer than 50000 characters.
args.name: simpleHtmlDescription

args.info: Required: event start time in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
args.name: time

args.info: Required: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions with each being up to 250 characters, including new questions. To delete a question submit this parameter with an empty value. See editEvent README for more details.
args.name: editQuestions

args.info: Required: Numeric identifier of a venue. To unset the event's venue, set this to 0
args.name: venueId

args.info: Required: If you are an organizer of the group, you may set this to "draft" or "published". Setting state to "draft" will require a status=draft filter on /2/event queries.
args.name: publishStatus

blocks.name: deleteEvent
blocks.description: Deletes a specified meetup

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: id
args.info: Required: Event id.

blocks.name: getCities
blocks.description: Returns Meetup cities. This method supports search by latitude/longitude/radius, by country/state, by query term/zip, or a combination of all of these. Location-only searches by lat and lon return all cities within a radius of the provided coordinates. Searches with a query return up to 10 cities matching the term, and can be sorted by size or distance to a given coordinate. 'smart' ordering can be used to return the match(es) with the highest member_count, unless a smaller size match exists nearby the given coordinates. Query searches are supported for country but not country and state

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: A valid country code
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Search term and/or zip to look for (if this is specified, max result size limited to 10)
args.name: query

args.info: Required: Longitude to search
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: A valid state code for the given country, if the country has states
args.name: state

args.info: Required: When searching by lat/lon only, specify a radius to search (default 50 miles)
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Latitude to search
args.name: latitude

blocks.name: getMembers
blocks.description: API method for accessing members of Meetup Groups

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Return members for the group with given topic and number
args.name: groupNum

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return members for the group with given topic and number
args.name: topic

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return members for the group with the given custom URL path
args.name: groupUrlName

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return the member with this ID
args.name: memberId

args.info: Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return members in groups with these ID numbers, separated by commas
args.name: groupId

args.info: Required: Recomended: Match users by the external services they've linked to their member account, specified as "servicename:identifier". For example, "service=twitter:@MeetupAPI" finds any member account that lists @MeetupAPI as its Twitter name (none, currently). You can query against several at a time by separating them with commas. Facebook identifiers should be provided as numeric values
args.name: service

args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: id
args.info: Required: Memeber id
Required: Day you were born. Format should be in the form of yyyy or mmddyyyy. A value of -1 indicates that birthday data should be cleared.
args.name: birthday

args.info: Required: Valid zip code for city
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: Valid country code for your location
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Hometown of member. Can not be longer than 64 characters
args.name: hometown

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to remove from your alert list
args.name: removeTopics

args.info: Required: Your gender (used for better recommendations). Value may be one of other, none, female, male

args.info: Required: A valid photo_id from the member's photos to set as the main profile photo. A value of 0 will unset the current photo
args.name: photoId

args.info: Required: City name for your location
args.name: city

args.info: Required: Controls the visibility of the member's topics. May be one of visible, hidden
args.name: topicsPrivacy

args.info: Required: Controls the visibility of the member's facebook connection. May be one of visible, hidden. If the member has not connected their Facebook account, attempts to set this preference will do nothing.
args.name: facebookPrivacy

args.info: Required: Free form text passage about you. must be less than 250 characters
args.name: bio

args.info: Required: longitude of city
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Controls the visibility of the member's groups. May be one of visible, hidden
args.name: groupsPrivacy

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of topics ids to add to your alert list
args.name: addTopics

args.info: Required: When set to true, this parameter will sync all of the group profile photos for the member with the provided photo_id
args.name: syncPhoto

args.info: Required: The name of the current member
args.name: name

args.info: Required: Controls the visibility of the member's bio. May be one of visible, hidden
args.name: bioPrivacy

args.info: Required: Controls the visibility of the member's photos. May be one of visible, hidden
args.name: photosPrivacy

args.info: Required: Language preference used on the site. Valid values are en-us, en-au, de-de, es, es-es, fr-fr, it-it, pt-br, ja-jp, ko-kr, nl-nl, en_us, en_au, de_de, es, es_es, fr_fr, it_it, pt_br, ja_jp, ko_kr, nl_nl, en, en, de, es, es, fr, it, pt, ja, ko, nl
args.name: lang

args.info: Required: radius, in miles to search for city given a lat and lon. default 25.0, max 100.0
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: latitude of city
args.name: latitude

args.info: Required: This specifies the member's preference for being contacted from members on the site. Possible values are "orgs_only" meaning only group organizers can contact you, "groups_only" meaning only members of your group can contact you, or "all_members" meaning all members may contact you.
args.name: messagingPref

args.info: Required: Valid city id from /2/cities method
args.name: cityId

blocks.name: getProfiles

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return the profiles for members with these IDs, separated by commas

args.info: Required: comma delimited list of optional response properties. A value of "membership_dues" will populate membership dues for the authorized user or members of the groups the authorized user organizes
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: Recomended: Return profiles in the group with this ID
args.name: groupId

args.info: Required: Status filter for members. Only organizers may see pending. Request must also contain a `group_id` or `group_urlname`. Status may be one of active, pending
args.name: status

Required: Recomended: A valid latitude, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

args.info: Required: Recomended: For the US, a valid 2 character state code
args.name: state

args.info: Required: Recomended: Venues that contain the given term or terms somewhere in their content. Separate terms with " AND " for venues that have combined terms. Append a trailing * to treat this as a prefix search
args.name: text

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid US zip code, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid country code.
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid longitude, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Recomended: Returns venues with location relative to the group associated with this urlname
args.name: groupUrlName

args.info: Required: Recomended: A valid city
args.name: city

args.info: Required: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25.0 -- maximum 100.0
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output
args.name: fields

Required: Recomended: multiple ids may be separated with commas

args.info: Required: Recomended: multiple ids may be separated with commas
args.name: eventId

blocks.name: getRSVPs

Required: Parameter for requesting optional response properties, set to other_services for a list of third party services

args.info: Required: Recomended: Multiple alphanumeric ids may be separated with commas
args.name: eventId

blocks.name: postRSVP
blocks.description: Creates or updates an existing RSVP

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Recomended: The RSVP setting - value must be either "yes", "no" or "waitlist"
args.name: rsvp

args.info: Required: Organizers and event hosts may RSVP on behalf of a member by specifying an ID here. As when editing RSVPs on the site, organizers may enter a "yes" for a member even if the event requires payment.
args.name: memberId

args.info: Required: A comment to post along with the RSVP
args.name: comments

args.info: Required: Recomended: The event that you are RSVP'ing to
args.name: eventId

args.info: Required: Number of guests also coming to the event.
args.name: guests

args.info: Required: For events with fees, the authorized member may opt to pay as part of the RSVP request. This may be set to true or false
args.name: optionToPay

args.info: Required: Answers to event survey questions. Answers may not be longer than 250 characters. Organizers and hosts my not edit or create answers on behalf of members
args.name: provideAnswer

args.info: Required: For events with fees, the authorized member must agree to the event's refund policy. This must be set to either true or false
args.name: agreeToRefund

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible
args.name: await

args.info: Required: Set to 'true' to have this photo become the group's main photo. Set it to 'false' otherwise. Defaults to true
args.name: main

args.info: Required: Recomended: Group ID for the target group. This may be used as an alternative to group_urlname
args.name: groupId

args.info: Required: Recomended: The photo. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB
args.name: photo

args.info: Required: Recomended: Group urlname. This may be used as an alternative to group_id
args.name: groupUrlName

blocks.name: postMemberPhoto

args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible
args.name: await

args.info: Required: Set to "true" to have this photo become the member's main profile photo. Otherwise, it will become the main photo only when none other is selected. If the authenticated member does not already have a main profile photo set it will remain so.
args.name: main

args.info: Required: When set to true and main is set to true, this will replace all group profile photos matching the current photo with the provided replacement
args.name: syncMatchingPhoto

args.info: Required: Recomended: The photo. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB
args.name: photo

args.info: Required: When set to true, this parameter will sync all of the group profile photos for the member with the provided photo_id
args.name: syncPhoto

blocks.name: postPhoto

Required: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible

args.info: Required: Caption for the photo
args.name: caption

args.info: Required: Recomended: Identifier of an existing photo album, which may be an event or group album
args.name: photoAlbumId

args.info: Required: Recomended: The photo. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

args.name: eventId

args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

blocks.name: membershipApproval
blocks.description: Approves one or more requests for group membership

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.
Required: Comma-delimited numeric pending member IDs. The maximum allowed is 200
args.name: member

args.info: Required: Optional message to send to the members being approved. If not provided, the groups default welcome message will be sent. Max message size is 2000
args.name: welcomeMessage

args.info: Required: Optional boolean value indicating whether or not the org should receive a copy of the message sent to the approved members
args.name: sendCopy

blocks.name: getEventAttendance
blocks.description: Lists attendance records for Meetup events. Limited for use by administrative members.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.

args.name: id
args.info: Required: Event id.

Required: A named filter to apply to the attendance list. These are roughly equivalent to the set of filters you will see in the attendance tool on the site. These filters correspond with attendance records as well as each member's original RSVP status. The filter value be one of: legacy, maybe, waitlist, yes, absent, all, attended, noshow, excused, relevant, no. The default is 'attended'. The 'absent' filter represents all members not in attendance including members with a 'noshow' status. An 'excused' absence is an absent member marked as such by an administrative member
args.name: filter

args.info: Required: Raw text used to search for member by name. This may only be applied when the filter parameter is set to 'all'. The provided text must consist of at least 2 characters.
args.name: member

blocks.name: takeEventAttendance
blocks.description: Takes member attendance for an event. Limited for use by administrative members.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.

args.name: id
args.info: Required: Event id.
Required: The number of guests accompanying member. Maximum of 99 is allowed. When providing multiple values in the `member` field, this value is ignored
args.name: guests

args.info: Required: Sets the overall headcount for the event. This may not necessarily correlate with the list of attendees in this group if the event is part of a joint Meetup event. When providing multiple values in the `member` field, this value is ignored
args.name: headCount

args.info: Required: Recomended: A comma-delimited list of valid ids associated with members RSVP'd to the event
args.name: member

args.info: Required: Recomended: An attendance status for the provided members. Must be one of: noshow, absent, attended
args.name: status

args.name: urlname

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.
Required: Comma-delimited numeric pending member IDs. The maximum allowed is 200
args.name: member

args.info: Required: Optional Boolean value indicating whether the declining member's email address should be hidden in the resulting response. Default is true.
args.name: anonymous

args.info: Required: Optional Boolean value indicating whether or not to send a copy to the member issuing the decline. Default is false
args.name: sendCopy

args.info: Required: Optional explanation to send to the members being declined. Max message size is 2000
args.name: explanation

args.info: Required: Optional Boolean value indicating whether or not to ban the member in the future. Default is false
args.name: ban

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.

args.name: boardId

args.name: discussionId
args.info: Required: Discussion ID

blocks.name: getSelfEvents
blocks.description:
Gets a listing of all scheduled Meetup Events the authenticated member has RSVP'd to
that have been announced to the group.
This listing is ordered from oldest to most recent by default

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

Required: A string representing a scroll target.

Supported values are as follows.

__recent_past__: Scroll to the last RSVP'd Meetup Event that has passed.
 If there is no recent RSVP, this defaults to __next_upcoming__

__next_upcoming__: Scroll to the next upcoming Meetup Event the authenticated member
RSVP'd to.

Alternatively the server may generate a scroll value used for pagination Link headers.
Clients should treat the contents of those as a transparent string. Its
contents are subject to change in the future
args.name: scroll

args.info: Required: Number of results to return. Defaults to 200.
args.name: page

args.info: Required: A comma-delimited list of optional fields names which may be appended to the response
args.name: fields

args.info:
Required: Comma-delimited list of RSVP responses.
Valid values are "waitlist" or "yes". The default is "yes"
args.name: rsvp

args.info: Required: When true, sorts results in descending order. Defaults to false
args.name: desc

args.info:
Required: Comma-delimited list of event statuses.
Valid values are "past" or "upcoming"
args.name: status

blocks.name: getSingleEvent
blocks.description: Fetches a Meetup Event by group urlname and event_id

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.

args.name: id
args.info: Required: Event id.
Required: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response
args.name: fields

blocks.name: postEventPayments
blocks.description: Allows organizers of a group to note payments made by members for an event. This is the 'Mark Paid' feature seen in the RSVP listings on event details pages and affects the 'pay_status' response fields in [2/rsvps](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/2/rsvps/#response) for paid events

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.

args.name: id
args.info: Required: Event id.
Required: Recomended: The monetary amount of money the member submitted
args.name: amount

args.info: Required: The number of payments made. Defaults to 1
args.name: quantity

args.info: Required: Recomended: Member Id of member who made a payment
args.name: member

args.info: Required: The time the payment was made in milliseconds from the epoc. Defaults to now
args.name: paidOn

blocks.name: findGroups
blocks.description: Text, location, category and friend-based group searches

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Zipcode of location to limit search to
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: A valid two character country code, defaults to US
args.name: country

args.info: Required: If true, filters text and category based searches on groups that have upcoming events. Defaults to false
args.name: upcomingEvents

args.info: Required: Approximate longitude
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Determines which groups are returned. If 'all' (default), the text and category parameters are applied. If 'friends', groups your friends are in are returned. The value of this parameter may be one of all, friends
args.name: filter

args.info: Required: boolean indicator of whether or not to return a list of curated suggestions for groups if we can't find groups matching your criteria
args.name: fallbackSuggestions

args.info: Required: Raw text location query
args.name: location

args.info: Required: Raw full text search query
args.name: text

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of numeric topic ids
args.name: topicId

args.info: Required: Radius in miles. May be 0.0-100.0, 'global' or 'smart', a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area. Defaults to member's preferred radius
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of numeric category ids
args.name: category

args.info: Required: set to 'include' or 'exclude' Meetups the authorized member belongs to; default is 'include'
args.name: selfGroups

args.info: Required: Approximate latitude
args.name: latitude

blocks.name: getSingleGroup
blocks.description: Fetches a Meetup group by urlname

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.
Required: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response
args.name: fields

blocks.name: editGroup
blocks.description: Allows organizers to edit their Meetup group information. To change group topics, see the [add](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/topics/#add) and [remove](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/topics/#remove) topics endpoints. To change group photo use the [Group photo upload](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/2/group_photo/#create) endpoint. OAuth authenticated requests require an additional [group_edit](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes) permission.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.
Required: The ZIP code of the city
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: The ISO_3166-1 country code for the country which contains the city
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Defines policy for who can post to the group mailing list. May be one of 'open' meaning any member can post, 'off' meaning no one can post, 'moderated' meaning messages must be approved, or 'orgs_only' meaning only organizers may post to the list
args.name: listMode

args.info: Required: Boolean parameter that will cause this endpoint to apply all validation rules without actually saving changes in which case the response will only reflect the group's current attributes
args.name: dryrun

args.info: Required: Google Analytics code for group
args.name: gaCode

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to disassociate with group
args.name: removeTopics

args.info: Required: Restricts group visibility for non-members. May be one of 'public', 'public_limited' or 'members'. Note, the 'members' option is only available to groups that already have 'members' visibility
args.name: visibility

args.info: Required: A new profile question defined in the order of index provided in the request parameter name. See editGroup README for more details.
args.name: addNewQuestions

args.info: Required: Group's primary photo. Must be ID of an existing album photo
args.name: keyPhoto

args.info: Required: Indicates that a member must provide a photo before joining. Expects true or false values
args.name: photoReq

args.info: Required: Summary of what the Meetup group is about in simple HTML format
args.name: description

args.info: Required: Indicates that provided questions are required before joining. Expects true or false values
args.name: questionsReq

args.info: Required: Message sent to members after they join. Can be at most 2000 characters
args.name: welcomeMessage

args.info: Required: Controls how member's are let into the group. May be one of 'open' meaning any Meetup member my join, 'closed' meaning group is not currently accepting new members, or 'approval' meaning members must be approved by an organizer. Note, the 'closed' options is only available to groups that already have a 'closed' join_mode
args.name: joinMode

args.info: Required: Mailing list prefix. By default this is the group's urlname.
args.name: listAddr

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to associate with group
args.name: addTopics

args.info: Required: A URI for a social network service. Service must be one of facebook, flickr, linkedin, other, tumblr, twitter
args.name: serviceUri

args.info: Required: Display name of the group. Can be at most 60 characters
args.name: name

args.info: Required: Edits a current profile question identified by an id in the parameter name. The index updated index should also be encoded in the parameter name. To delete a question, set this to an empty string. Groups that require profile questions must have at least one question
args.name: editQuestions

args.info: Required: Name used for the groups web address on meetup.com. Must be between 6 and 60 characters
args.name: urlname

args.info: Required: What members of the group will be called. Can be at most 32 characters
args.name: who

blocks.name: postTopics
blocks.description: Associates topics with a given Meetup group. Limited to organizers of the group. OAuth authenticated requests require an additional [group_edit](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes) permission.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname

Required: Recomended: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to associate with group

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.
Required: Recomended: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to disassociate with group

Required: The desired number of locations to return in a single set of results.

args.info:
Required: Search for locations based on location latitude.
Must be provided with "longitude"

args.info: Required: Search for locations based on city name or zip code

Required: A comma-delimited list of optional fields names which may be appended to the response

blocks.name: getSelfGroups
blocks.description:
Lists the authenticated member's groups in the order of leadership,
next upcoming event, then alphabetical order by name

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response
args.name: fields

args.info:
Required: Number of groups to return in a single page of results.
By default, this is 200
args.name: page

blocks.name: getPROGroups
blocks.description: Name and statistics range search for the meetup groups belonging to Pro organization.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.
Required: String: Country
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the total number of past RSVPs
args.name: pastRsvpsMin

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the number of the past events held
args.name: pastEventsMin

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the number of members
args.name: memberCountMax

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the number of the upcoming events
args.name: upcomingEventsMin

args.info: Required: Float: Longitude
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: Minumum range of the date that the last meetup happened
args.name: lastEventMin

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the average number of repeat rsvpers
args.name: repeatRsvpersMin

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the average age of the members
args.name: averageAgeMin

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: Maximum range of the date that the last meetup happened
args.name: lastEventMax

args.info: Required: String: `global`, `smart`, or search radius in Float
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Float: Latitude
args.name: latitude

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: Minumum range of the founded dates of the groups
args.name: foundedDateMin

args.info: Required: List of String: attributes to sort on
args.name: order

args.info: Required: String: Zip code
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: including only those groups that did not have event in the last specified days
args.name: inactiveWithinDays

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: the page offset
args.name: offset

args.info: Required: List of Integers: the ids of topic of the group
args.name: topics

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the number of the upcoming events
args.name: upcomingEventsMax

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the average age of the members
args.name: averageAgeMax

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: Maximum range of the dates the groups joined Pro organization
args.name: proJoinDateMax

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: Minumum range of the date that the next meetup is scheduled
args.name: nextEventMin

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the total number of past RSVPs
args.name: pastRsvpsMax

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: including only those groups that had event in the last specified days
args.name: activeWithinDays

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the average number of RSVPs per event
args.name: rsvpsPerEventMin

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: Maximum range of the founded dates of the groups
args.name: foundedDateMax

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Minimum range of the number of members
args.name: memberCountMin

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the number of the past events held
args.name: pastEventsMax

args.info: Required: String: Name of the group looking for
args.name: name

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: Maximum range of the date that the next meetup is scheduled
args.name: nextEventMax

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the average number of repeat rsvpers
args.name: repeatRsvpersMax

args.info: Required: String: Raw location
args.name: location

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: the size of page window
args.name: page

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: Minumum range of the dates the groups joined Pro organization
args.name: proJoinDateMin

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the average number of RSVPs per event
args.name: rsvpsPerEventMax

args.info: Required: List of Integers: the ids of the category of the group
args.name: category

args.info: Required: List of Boolean: whether to sort ascending or decending on each attributes in `order`
args.name: desc

blocks.name: getPROMembers
blocks.description: Name, location, and time based search for the members of the meetups belonging to Pro organization.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.
Required: String: Zip code
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: String: Country
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Maximum number of attended events
args.name: eventsAttendedMax

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: the page offset
args.name: offset

args.info: Required: List of Integers: The chapters which the member belongs to
args.name: chapters

args.info: Required: Boolean: To limit to only organizers or non-organizers
args.name: isOrganizer

args.info: Required: Float: Longitude
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: String: Name of the member
args.name: memberName

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: The range of date from the past until today, for the recent activity
args.name: activeWithinDays

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: The oldest time limit for member join
args.name: joinTimeMin

args.info: Required: Integers: The id of a previous emails that the member received
args.name: emailReceived

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: Minimum number of attended events
args.name: eventsAttendedMin

args.info: Required: String: Raw location
args.name: location

args.info: Required: Positive Integer: the size of page window
args.name: page

args.info: Required: String: `global`, `smart`, or search radius in Float
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Milliseconds since epoch: The latest time limit for member join
args.name: joinTimeMax

args.info: Required: Float: Latitude
args.name: latitude

args.info: Required: Boolean: whether to sort ascending or decending
args.name: desc

args.info: Required: String: attribute to sort on
args.name: order

blocks.name: getNotifications
blocks.description: Returns all recent Meetup notifications for the authorized member. To mark notifications read use [/notifications/read](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/notifications/read/) endpoint. To get the authenticated Member's current unread count, request it in an [HTTP header](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/#meta-headers).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.
args.name: fields

blocks.name: setNotificationsRead
blocks.description: Marks groups of [notifications](http://meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/notifications/) as read.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: The id of the newest notification item, typically the first in the list returned by the notifications endpoint
args.name: sinceId

blocks.name: findTopicCategories
blocks.description: Returns a list high level topic categories

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: An optional approximate longitude to center a request for "best_topics"
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: A comma-limited list of optional fields to append to the response
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: An radius (in miles) to center a request for "best_topics"
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: An optional approximate latitude to center a request for "best_topics"
args.name: latitude

blocks.name: getRecommendedGroupTopics
blocks.description: Recommends suggestions for group topics based on a text search or other topics

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Target number of recommendations to return. Defaults to 36.
args.name: page

args.info: Required: Free form text search
args.name: text

args.info: Required: Defines a language preference for ordering results. Valid values are en-USen-AUde-DEeses-ESfr-FRit-ITpt-BRja-JPko-KRnl-NLen-aude-dept-bren-uses-esnl-nlit-itfr-frko-krja-jpendefritptjakonl. You may also substitute this with the Accept-Language header
args.name: lang

args.info: Required: A comma-delimited list of topic ids to inform recommendations
args.name: otherTopics

args.info: Required: A comma-delimited list of topic ids to exclude from the recommendations
args.name: excludeTopics

blocks.name: getRecommendedGroups
blocks.description: Returns groups Meetup finds relevant to you

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Zip code you are searching for recommendations in
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: A valid two character country code, defaults to US
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Recommend only groups without join requirements and that can be joined instantly
args.name: instantJoinOnly

args.info: Required: Raw text location query
args.name: location

args.info: Required: Approximate longitude
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Comma delimited list of up to 100 topic ids to help inform recommendations
args.name: topicId

args.info: Required: Radius in miles. May be 0.0-100.0, 'global' or 'smart', a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area. Defaults to member's preferred radius
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.
args.name: fields

args.info: Required: A valid category id which limits recommended groups to a particular category
args.name: category

args.info: Required: Approximate latitude
args.name: latitude

blocks.name: postRecommendedGroupsIgnore
blocks.description: Provides a form of feedback by requesting to remove a group from future recommendations

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.

blocks.name: getRecommendedVenues
blocks.description: Returns venues Meetup finds relevant to you based on location and category. This method does not yet support sorting or pagination.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Zip code you are searching for recommendations in
args.name: zip

args.info: Required: A valid two character country code, defaults to US
args.name: country

args.info: Required: Return venues that have been used within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above).
args.name: usedBetween

args.info: Required: The minimum number of groups that have hosted events at this venue
args.name: minGroups

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 group ids to help inform recommendations
args.name: groupId

args.info: Required: Raw text location query
args.name: location

args.info: Required: Approximate longitude
args.name: longitude

args.info: Required: Radius in miles. Defaults to member's preferred radius
args.name: radius

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 category ids to help inform recommendations
args.name: category

args.info: Required: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 group urlnames to help inform recommendations
args.name: groupUrlName

args.info: Required: Approximate latitude
args.name: latitude

blocks.name: getSimilarGroups
blocks.description: Renders a list of similar groups

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token

args.name: urlname
args.info: Required: Group url name.

blocks.name: findTopics
blocks.description: Find topics by name

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: OAuth2 Access Token
Required: Recomended: The text to topic text search for
args.name: query

args.info: Required: Number of results to return in a single set of results
args.name: page
